quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: People and Octopus
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, lakes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many keys are on a piano?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 88

questions.question: The 1950 book The Martian Chronicles, describing the conflict between the colonists from Earth and the aboriginal Martians, was written by which author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Bradbury

questions.question: How many teeth does and adult have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 32

questions.question: How many stories does the Empire State Building have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 102

questions.question: Approximately how many people attended the soccer match between Uruguay and Brazil during the 1950 FIFA World Cup tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 199,800

questions.question: How many stripes are on the American Flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13

questions.question: This Canadian comedy troupe started out in 1984 and included actor Dave Foley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kids in the Hall

questions.question: Which 1996 animated live-action film featured cartoon character Marvin the Martian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Space Jam

questions.question: In 1971 David Bowies song Life on Mars? appeared on which of his albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hunky Dory

questions.question: Which famous book by British writer H.G. Wells presents the Martians as having octopus-like bodies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War of the Worlds

questions.question: How many planets are in the Solar System?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: How many North American Great Lakes are there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: How many legs does a spider have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: How many arms does the octopus have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: This musical group debuted on Saturday Night Live in 1978 and released an album called Briefcase Full of Blues that same year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blues Brothers

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Father and Mars
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cartoon, smith. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who wrote the music for Brian de Palmas 2000 movie Mission to Mars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ennio Morricone

questions.question: The Roman god of war Mars corresponds to which god from the Greek mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ares

questions.question: Which of the following is not an original member of The Mamas  the Papas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jill Gibson

questions.question: Which feature on the surface of Mars inspired Iron Maidens song Face in The Sand, included in their album Dance Of Death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Face on Mars

questions.question: Approximately how long is the Martian solar day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 24 hours 39 minutes

questions.question: Which group recorded the hit single Sugar Daddy in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackson 5

questions.question: Stan Smith is married to Francine and is the father of Hayley and Steve in this popular cartoon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Dad!

questions.question: Who was the father of Jem and Scout in the novel To Kill a Mockingbird?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atticus Finch

questions.question: Daddy Warbucks is a character in this popular musical that opened in April 21, 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie

questions.question: In the cartoon Augie Doggie and Doggie Daddy, Doggie Daddy spoke like what entertainer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Durante

questions.question: What is the name of the British sitcom about the Home Guard during World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dads Army

questions.question: On the 2006 album Stadium Arcadium by the Red Hot Chili Peppers, which song is about the death of  bassist Fleas dog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death of a Martian

questions.question: Who portrays Nicoles (Staci Keanan) two fathers on the TV sitcom My Two Dads?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Reiser and Greg Evigan

questions.question: When were the 107 episodes of the American sitcom My Favorite Martian first aired?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the 1960s

questions.question: What classic song is often played at weddings during the brides dance with her father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daddys Little Girl

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Child
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, breakey, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first European child, born in the Western Hemisphere, was born in what would become this country/state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

questions.question: Ross Rebagliati, Karine Ruby, Gian Simmen, Nicola Thost, Anton Pogue, Stacia Hookman, Steve Persons, and Sabrina Sadeghi are prominent names in this  sport.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snowboarding

questions.question: A 1672 painting in Dobarsko in this country depicts Jesus in a rocket ship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulgaria

questions.question: Where will you find the first public park in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston, Massachusetts

questions.question: The great medieval artist, Albrect Durer wrote a textbook in this subject.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geometry

questions.question: What was the first Broadway comedy to run for over 5500 performances?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh! Calcutta

questions.question: What did Norman Breakey invent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The paint roller

questions.question: Who is regarded as the first professional (American style) football player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Heffelfinger

questions.question: He was the first child born in the White House in Washington, D.C.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison Randolph

questions.question: Where was the first American-made motorcycle manufactured?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Springfield , Massachusetts

questions.question: In this language, jo reggelt means good morning and Beszel angolul means Do you speak English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hungarian

questions.question: Who wrote Jude the Obscure, The Mayor of Casterbridge, and Far From the Madding Crowd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Hardy

questions.question: This country is a democratic, parliamentary republic that has over 1500 islands, 700 rivers and streams, and 1000 lakes. During the winter, the shortest day is only 6 hours long. Smoked trout is a typical food  there.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Estonia

questions.question: This malleable, ductile, gray-white metal is very valuable. It is used in jewelry, in the production of electrical equipment, and in automobile emission systems. Certain compounds of this metal have  shown to be effective in destroying tumors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Platinum

questions.question: Where was the first iron bridge built?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coalbrookdale, England

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, ......, hill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This word means a detailed record of a persons life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dossier

questions.question: Complete this quote: Apres moi , le ......
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deluge

questions.question: What is the largest country in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia

questions.question: The capital city of this country was once known as The Little Paris of Eastern Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romania

questions.question: According to Greek mythology, he was the best friend of Pythias.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Damion

questions.question: Does Turkey belong only in Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Elena Andrionovna was born to Andrian Nikolayev and Valentina Tereshkova. Which statement is true about her?

options.text: Both her parents had been in outer space.
She was the first child born after the demise of the USSR.
She was the first child born by a surrogate mother.
She was the first child born in the offices of the KGB.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both her parents had been in outer space.

questions.question: Greenland is part of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmark

questions.question: What is the largest sea in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South China Sea

questions.question: The very advanced ocean liner, The Queen Mary II, was built in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: What was the location of the final battle of the First Indo-China War between France and Vietnam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dien Bien Phu

questions.question: The Krahule hill , known as the geographic center of Europe, is it located in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slovakia

questions.question: What is the deepest lake in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baikal

questions.question: What country is generally regarded as the oldest republic in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Marino

questions.question: Is Aconcagua the tallest mountain in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Fiction and Novels
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, citation. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What author of fiction wrote the eight novels known as The Kent Family Chronicles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Jakes

questions.question: Which of these is a name of a Truffaut movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Day for Night

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a state capital?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas

questions.question: Excluding map supplements and special editions, how many issues of The National Geographic Magazine are published each year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: In what 1960s ABC series do the characters attack, harass and wreak havoc on Field Marshal Rommels vaunted Afrika Korps?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rat Patrol

questions.question: Name the 1978 thriller in which a Nazi death-camp doctor attempts to clone Adolf Hitler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Boys from Brazil

questions.question: What is a doula?

options.text: A non-professional person who assists a woman during the time of  giving birth and during the postpartum period
A highly -trained computer technician who advises web designers in the silicon-valley  of France

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A non-professional person who assists a woman during the time of  giving birth and during the postpartum period

questions.question: What is the meaning of dyspepsia?

options.text: A disease that is characterized by difficulty in reading
A recurrent  pain, hardness or ache in the upper abdomen
A religious calendar used by several non-Western groups

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A recurrent  pain, hardness or ache in the upper abdomen

questions.question: What British singer recorded her biggest hit, Downtown in 1964?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petula Clark

questions.question: The following citation is taken from this novel of F. Scott Fitzgerald.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Gatsby

questions.question: Who wrote the collection of 100 novellas known as The Decameron?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giovanni Boccaccio

questions.question: Under what name is the Mr. Clean brand name known in Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meister Proper

questions.question: This is the word in Jewish folklore for a spirit that inhabits the soul and body of a dead person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dybbuk

questions.question: What term refers to the events following the climax in a dramatic play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denouement

questions.question: Who became famous in 1957 with the Jamaican folk song, The Banana Boat Song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Belafonte

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Air and Years
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, fruits, potato. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How big was the first telephone book?

questions.question: You can fry an egg on a sidewalk when it reaches how many degrees Fahrenheit?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atari 2600

questions.question: What was the first song transmitted from space to Earth?

options.text: The I Love Lucy Theme Song
There has been no song transmitted from space to Earth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happy Birthday

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1/25

questions.question: Which was the first Disney production to show the death of a main character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lion King

questions.question: Spit can freeze in mid-air at the North Pole.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Potato flavored ice cream can be bought in Idaho.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Sharks rarely attack humans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these fruits has a variety called Abraham Lincoln?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tomato

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: The average US penny stays in circulation for 50 years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many teeth do slugs have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3,000

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Daley
